Uses of Class
MPC.Expr

    • Uses of Expr in MPC

      Subclasses of Expr in MPC 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ExprBinary
      Representation for a binary expression.
      class  ExprBinding
      Representation for an expression binding.
      class  ExprCall
      Representation of a function or procedure call.
      class  ExprError
      Represents a parse error.
      class  ExprId
      Represents an identifier expression.
      class  ExprInt
      Representation for a literal integer expression.
      class  ExprNil
      Representation of NIL in a Pascal program.
      class  ExprString
      Representation of a literal string expression.
      class  ExprUnary
      Representation of a unary expression.
      Fields in MPC declared as Expr 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Expr StmtCall.call
      The call Expr containing the procedure name and a possibly empty list of actual parameters
      Expr DeclConst.expr
      The right-hand side of the constant declaration
      Expr ExprUnary.expr
      the Expr upon which the operator operates; cannot be final because sometimes we insert operations into the tree
      Expr StmtAssign.expr
      right-hand side Expr of an assignment.
      Expr StmtCase.expr
      the ordinal expression (case index) Expr
      Expr StmtIf.expr
      the boolean Expr controlling the IF statement
      Expr StmtRepeat.expr
      the until Expr
      Expr StmtWhile.expr
      the boolean while Expr
      Expr ExprBinary.expr1
      the first (left hand) expression upon which the binary operatory operates; cannot be final because sometimes we insert operations into the tree
      Expr ExprBinary.expr2
      the second (right hand) expression upon which the binary operatory operates; cannot be final because sometimes we insert operations into the tree
      Expr TypeRange.hi
      Expr giving largest value of subrange type; should be a constant
      Expr StmtFor.init
      the initialization Expr
      Expr TypeRange.lo
      Expr giving smallest value of subrange type; should be a constant
      static Expr Expr.theFalseExpr
      built-in primitive Mini-Pascal FALSE expression
      static Expr Expr.theNilExpr
      built-in primitive Mini-Pascal NIL expression
      static Expr Expr.theTrueExpr
      built-in primitive Mini-Pascal TRUE expression
      Expr StmtFor.to
      final (ending value) Expr
      Expr StmtAssign.var
      left-hand side Expr of an assignment.
      Fields in MPC with type parameters of type Expr 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.util.List<Expr> Exprs.exprs
      a List holding the Expr nodes
      Methods in MPC that return Expr 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Expr Expr.subscriptedExprOf(Expr e1, java.util.List<Expr> ee)
      Static factory method for creating proper trees for subscripted expressions
      Methods in MPC that return types with arguments of type Expr 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Iterator<Expr> CaseLabelList.iterator()
      Makes it easy to iterate over the labels, each of which should be an Expr
      java.util.Iterator<Expr> Exprs.iterator()
      Provides a convenient iterator over the Expr nodes in the list
      Methods in MPC with parameters of type Expr 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Expr Expr.subscriptedExprOf(Expr e1, java.util.List<Expr> ee)
      Static factory method for creating proper trees for subscripted expressions
      void ASTNullVisitor.visitExpr(Expr e) 
      void ASTVisitor.visitExpr(Expr e) 
      void ASTNullVisitor.visitExprAfter(Expr e) 
      void ASTPrintVisitor.visitExprAfter(Expr e)
      Concludes printing an Expr: prints Type (if any) and unindents
      void ASTVisitor.visitExprAfter(Expr e) 
      void ASTNullVisitor.visitExprBefore(Expr e) 
      void ASTPrintVisitor.visitExprBefore(Expr e)
      Prints a tag for all Expr nodes, and fields common to all Expr's: (allocated object, rhs/lhs (rvalue/lvalue), (estimated registers needed to evaluate)
      void ASTVisitor.visitExprBefore(Expr e) 
      Method parameters in MPC with type arguments of type Expr 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Expr Expr.subscriptedExprOf(Expr e1, java.util.List<Expr> ee)
      Static factory method for creating proper trees for subscripted expressions
      Constructors in MPC with parameters of type Expr 
      Constructor and Description
      DeclConst(Binding b, Expr e)
      Creates a new DeclConst instance given its Binding (name) and Expr (value).
      ExprBinary(Token o, Expr e1, Expr e2)
      Creates a new ExprBinary instance given the operator and left and right subexpressions
      ExprUnary(Token o, Expr e, int left, int right)
      Creates a new ExprUnary instance given the TokenOp (operator), Expr (subexpression), and the source (start/end) position
      StmtAssign(Expr v, Expr e)
      Creates a new StmtAssign instance given its var Expr and its expr Expr
      StmtCall(Expr c)
      Creates a new StmtCall instance given its call Expr
      StmtCase(Expr e, java.util.List<CaseElement> l, int left, int right)
      Creates a new StmtCase instance given its case index Expr, List of CaseElement's, and source (start/end) position
      StmtFor(Binding b, Expr i, boolean up, Expr t, Stmt st, int left, int right)
      Creates a new StmtFor instance given the Binding (name) of its control variable, the init Expr, direction of progression (up/down), the final/limit Expr, the Stmt for the loop body, and the source (start/end) position
      StmtIf(Expr e, Stmt st, Stmt se, int left, int right)
      Creates a new StmtIf instance given its controlling boolean Expr, then Stmt, else Stmt (which may be null), and source (start/end) position
      StmtRepeat(Stmts ss, Expr e, int left, int right)
      Creates a new StmtRepeat instance given its Stmts, until Expr, and source (start/end) position
      StmtWhile(Expr e, Stmt s, int left, int right)
      Creates a new StmtWhile instance given its while Expr, its Stmt body, and its source (start/end) position
      TypeRange(Expr le, Expr he)
      Creates a new TypeRange instance given its lo and hi Expr nodes
      Constructor parameters in MPC with type arguments of type Expr 
      Constructor and Description
      CaseLabelList(java.util.List<Expr> ll, int left, int right)
      Creates a new CaseLabelList instance, given a List of Expr nodes for the values that select this case of the CASE statement and the start/end source code positions.
      Exprs(java.util.List<Expr> exprs, int left, int right)
      Creates a new Exprs instance given the List of Expr nodes and the source (start/end) position
